title: Amazon | SDE-1 | Bangalore (Offer)
summary: Education - Tier-2 College B.Tech CSEI had an OA + 3 interview rounds (online)December 2024 (last week) - Got a mail asking to apply for SDE-1 if I am interested. Since have applied to Amazon for summer internship before, they had my email ID.January
content:
Education - Tier-2 College B.Tech CSE

I had an OA + 3 interview rounds (online)

December 2024 (last week) - Got a mail asking to apply for SDE-1 if I am interested. Since have applied to Amazon for summer internship before, they had my email ID.

January 2025 (third week) - Got the OA link (medium)

First Question (Easy) - It was a greedy question in which you needed to count the minimum health a player needs to survive.
Second question (Medium) - Sliding window + hashmap question.
After DSA, it had the behaviorial part.

February 2025 (Second week) - Got the mail saying that I passed the OA and interviews will be scheduled soon.

February 2025 (Third week) - First interview round ( LP+DSA)

Started with each other's introduction and then 10 mins of Leadership Principles. He asked me 2 DSA questions.

First question - Build a data structure which can insert, search, delete and get random element in O(1) time. There was a follow up asking what if there are duplicates in the input.

Second question - Find square root of a number. I gave basic binary search answer then he followed up asking what if we want the answer with say 8 place decimal precision.

Need to tell time and space complexity of all codes. Brownie points if you explain with a dry run as well.

February 2025 (last week) - Got a call for the second interview at 11:30 am saying they want to schedule it that day 2 pm.

Second Round (LP+DSA) - Started just like the first one with introduction and then 10 mins of Leadership Principles. He asked 2 DSA questions.

First question - You are given the starting and ending times for ML models. Each model used a GPU to run. 4 GPUs make up 1 CPU. Find the minimum number of CPUs needed to run all the models. Basically this problem was a variation of the minimum number of platforms question. I followed with the line sweep algorithm first then he asked what if the time intervals are given in decimals then I told him the sorting+two pointers method.

Second Question - You are given a matrix full of 'S' and 'O'. Any 'O' or cluster of 'O' that are not covered by S from all directions become 'S' as well. We have to return the final state of the matrix. Basically any 'O' and the 'O' connected to it become
'S' as they are not covered, so you run a DFS for all 'o' on the edges and convert them one by one to 'S'. The rest of the 'O' after the DFS stay as 'O' only as they are surrounded by 'S'

Gave time and space complexity for both codes and the interview said at the end of interview that I did well (bro made me blush). Got mail
for the Bar Raised round 2 hours later scheduled for the next day.

February 2025 (last week) - Round 3 (Bar Raiser)

Interview started with Introduction and then started the spamming of Leadership Principles.
•  Tell me about a time when you worked on something outside your comfort zone.
•  Tell me about a time when you got negative feedback from a higher up.
And a lot more follow ups and questions.

We had 10-15 mins left after this rapid fire of Lps so the interviewer asked if I wanted to chat or he can ask a question. I just told him to ask a question, bro started smirking.

Question - We are given inputs in the form of Username - Page visited. We have to return the three page sequence which has been visited the most number of times by users.
Input - ‹ User1 - P1, User2 - P2, User1 - P3, ....}
So imagine User 1 has visited pages in the
order P1-P3-P4- P2
User2 has visited in the order P3-P4-P2-P1 and so on.
The final answer will be P3-P4-P2.
I just used hashmaps to store counts of 3 page sequences user by user and finally returned the sequence with max count.
Gave time and space complexity and the dry run.

March 2025 (Third week) - Got a call from Amazon recruiter saying congrats and they want to extend an offer. Made a grown man cry.

Compensation -
Base - 19,17,000
Sign-on Bonus - 6,47,000 + 5,18,000 (2 years)
RSU- 15,56,000 (5 + 15% + 40% + 40%) (4 years)
Relocation - 1,80,000

Current Exp - 8 months of internships 5 months of full time exp @CHWTIA

I am lucky to be under probation so my notice period is just 30 days.

title: L60 Offer at Microsoft
summary:
I recently went through the L60 hiring process at Microsoft and received an offer after multiple rounds of assessments and interviews. Here’s a breakdown of my experience:
Online Assessment (OA) Round (Happened in January month)
The process started w
content:
I recently went through the L60 hiring process at Microsoft and received an offer after multiple rounds of assessments and interviews. Here’s a breakdown of my experience:

1. **Online Assessment (OA) Round** (Happened in January month)

The process started with an OA consisting of two medium-hard DSA problems (LeetCode-style).

2. **Technical Interview - Round 1** (Feb month)

This round had two easy-medium DSA questions, focusing on problem-solving, optimization, and edge cases.

3. **Technical Interview - Round 2**(Same day as round 1)
	•	One medium Graph problem (BFS/DFS-based).
	•	HLD discussion, covering system scalability and architectural decisions.

4.** Technical Interview - Round 3** (Feb month)
	•	LLD Design: Parking Lot System, covering class structure, relationships, and key functionalities.

5. **Final Round - Hiring Manager (HM) Discussion** (March)

A 1-hour deep dive into my current work, covering technical contributions, challenges, and problem-solving approach.

Offer & Background

After clearing all rounds and submitting documents, I received the L60 offer.
	•	Education: TIER-2 College
	•	Experience: 1.5 years at an MNC
	•	Skills: DSA, HLD, LLD, System Design


The process was rigorous but well-structured, testing both coding and design skills.

title: JP Morgan | Associate (SDE-2) | Bangalore | [Offer]
summary:
Education: B.Tech (Tier - 2)
Years of Experience: 5.5 years
Current Position: Software Engineer (Associate) in a European Bank
Current Location: Pune

Corp
content:
Education: B.Tech (Tier - 2)
Years of Experience: 5.5 years
Current Position: Software Engineer (Associate) in a European Bank
Current Location: Pune

Corporate Title : Senior Associate (602)
Role : Java Backend Engineer
Location : Banaglore

I got a call from JP Morgan Chase to interview for a Senior Associate (602) role (Software Engineer - III) in November 2024. 
The initial call with the recruiter covered basic expectations - why do you want to switch, current experience, tech stack, current compensation, expected compensation etc. The recruiter shared that there will be 3 rounds as part of the process. Each round will be an elimination round.

**Round 1 (Java and Database/SQL) (1 hour)**

```
The round started with introduction from both sides. 
The interviewer explained what their team does and what is their current project. 
Then I was asked about my current role, my tech stack.

A few questions that I remember from this round - 
1. I was given a few examples of Strings and was expected to give the output for each of the comparison. 
The examples included typical string comparison using == and equals() method. 
The discussion naturally shifted towards String Constant Pool.
2. Internal Working of a Hashmap - how to implement it using an array and a bit of discussion about load factor.
3. I was given an problem statement to write a simple nested SQL query to fetch some data about employees from an Employee table.
4. Covered a bit about my projects, a bit about my experience with Maven, Jenkins and questions around.

Verdict: I cleared this round and got a call for 2nd round 2 days later.
```

**Round 2 (Design Round) (1 hour)**

```
Start of Round 2 was very similar to how Round 1. 
Started with introduction from both sides. 
The interviewer briefly mentioned about his role in the team.
Then I was asked about my current role, my tech stack 

Some questions that I remember from this round - 
1. A few pointers from my resume were discussed around - defect fixing, concurrency issues, recent technical challenges that I faced.
2. I had to design a reusable JAR library that can be used across multiple services.
3. How to fetch the Top K users that are logging into a website on a particular day.
What design decisions and algorithms would you choose to solve this proble if millions of users are logging into your website in a single day.

A few other qustions were asked that I cannot recollect now. 

Verdict : The round went okayish, not as good as the first round. 
I was contacted by the recruiter after 2-3 days and a third round was scheduled.
```

**Round 3 (Hiring Manager Round) (1 hour)**

```
This was a typical Hiring Manager round. 
The HM started with the introduction, project work, and his expections for the job role.

Typical behavioural interview questions were asked.

Verdict: I got a call from the recruiter after 2 days and she mentioned that they are ready to offer. 
Then she asked for documents to come up with numbers for the offer
```

The offer came in after a week of round 3 for an Associate position (601) (Software Engineer - II) instead of Senior Associate role (602) (Software Engineer - III

**Decision** : Declined the offer.
I was downleved to an Associate position (601) (Software Engineer - II). I did not want to take a downlevel to as I had already been an Associate at my current company for about 3 years and I also had a better offer from a different company for an SDE-3 position.

For compensation details you check my other post - https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6285579/JP-Morgan-or-Associate-(SDE-2)-or-Bangalore

title: Google | L4 | Hyderabad | Jan 2025 [Offer]
summary:
Hello LeetCode Community,

Education: Btech in Computer Science and Engineering from Tier 1 college
Years of Experience: 4+ years
Current Company: Top MNC (
content:
Hello LeetCode Community,

**Education:** Btech in Computer Science and Engineering from Tier 1 college
**Years of Experience:** 4+ years
**Current Company:** Top MNC (non FAANG)
**Current Position:** SDE2
**Current Location:** Bengaluru, India
**Offer Date:** January 22, 2025
**Current Compensation:** ₹50 LPA (₹36 LPA Base)
**LC Stats:** 673(146 E, 437 M, 90H)

I'm thrilled to share my Google L4 interview experience, from application to offer acceptance. I applied for a position at Google through their careers page in the first week of November 2024.  The very next day, I received an email from a Google recruiter requesting my resume, which I promptly sent. A couple of days later, the recruiter contacted me by phone to discuss my fit for Google and inquire about my availability for a phone screen. I requested three weeks to prepare.

**Interview Experience:**

**Phone Screening [December 12, 2024]:**
Initially scheduled for December 4th, the phone screen was postponed due to interviewer unavailability. The question was a relatively straightforward design problem involving a Priority Queue or TreeSet. I solved the problem with a small hint from the interviewer. No follow-up questions were asked. I then asked a few general questions, and the interview concluded.

Within a couple of hours, the recruiter contacted me to inform me that the phone screen feedback was positive, and I would be moving on to the on-site (virtual) rounds.

**Verdict: Hire**

A few days later, a different recruiter contacted me to schedule my on-site rounds. I requested that they be scheduled in the first week of January 2025.

**Round 1 [January 6, 2025]:**
I was asked a question similar to "Evaluate Expression," solvable using a stack. It was a variation of a common LeetCode problem. I addressed two follow-up questions, making necessary code adjustments. I completed everything within 40 minutes, performed dry runs with several examples, and explained the time and space complexities. The interviewer seemed pleased.

The following day, the recruiter informed me that the feedback was extremely positive.

**Verdict: Strong Hire**

**Round 2 [January 7, 2025]:**
This round focused on a graph problem, a variant of Dijkstra's algorithm. I coded the solution in 15 minutes, correcting a small bug pointed out by the interviewer. I was then asked a follow-up question, a modification of the initial problem. I coded the solution, performed a dry run, and explained the time and space complexities. The interviewer appeared satisfied.

The next day, the recruiter contacted me again, stating that the feedback was very good.

**Verdict: Strong Hire**

**Round 3 [January 8, 2025]:**
This was a rather unusual geometry question (I couldn't find a similar one on LeetCode). I solved it using BFS and explained the time and space complexities. While functional, the solution was suboptimal. The interviewer asked me to optimize it, and I proposed a DP solution, which was also suboptimal. With only 10 minutes remaining, the interviewer provided a hint, which enabled me to quickly devise and code the optimal solution. (I ran out of time; the interview lasted approximately 50 minutes.)

The following day, the recruiter contacted me, saying the feedback was mixed.

**Verdict: Lean Hire**

**Googleyness & Leadership (G&L) Round [January 10, 2025]:**
This round was quite relaxed. I felt over-prepared. The interviewer asked a few situational questions, after which I had the opportunity to ask general questions about Google's culture. The interview concluded within 20-25 minutes.

**Verdict: Strong Hire**

**January 13, 2025:** The recruiter called to explain that my on-site feedback was positive and that I would be moving on to team matching.

**January 15, 2025:** I was contacted about a potential team match and asked about my availability for the following day.

**Team Match [January 16, 2025]:**
I had a team match with a Google Cloud team based in Hyderabad. The Hiring Manager (HM) described the team, their work, and their tech stack. He asked me about my current work. I liked the work; the product seemed interesting, and Hyderabad is my preferred location. I was happy with the team.

**January 17, 2025:** The recruiter called to inform me that the HM wanted to proceed with me for the position. I confirmed my interest in the team. The recruiter then requested additional details to prepare the offer packet for the Hiring Committee (HC).

**January 21, 2025:** The recruiter called to inform me that the HC had approved my packet, and we had a preliminary compensation discussion.

**January 22, 2025:** We had the final compensation discussion. After a brief negotiation, we finalized the offer, and the recruiter released the offer letter, which I signed the same day.

title: Zeta | SDE1 Interview Experience | On-Campus | Feb 2025 | Offer
summary: Zeta recently visited our college for SDE hiring. Here’s my experience of the entire process.Round 1: Online AssessmentThe online assessment was conducted on th
content:
Zeta recently visited our college for SDE hiring. Here’s my experience of the entire process.
#### Round 1: Online Assessment

The online assessment was conducted on the Codejudge platform and consisted of 3 DSA questions to be solved in 90 minutes. This round was held on campus.

Questions asked:
1. [Trapping Rain Water](https://leetcode.com/problems/trapping-rain-water/description/)
2. [An easier variation of N Queens](https://leetcode.com/problems/n-queens/description/)
3. A 2D dynamic programming string question similar to [Interleaving Strings](https://leetcode.com/problems/interleaving-string/description/) and [Edit Distance](https://leetcode.com/problems/edit-distance/description/).

I was able to solve all three questions and got shortlisted for the next round.

#### Round 2: DSA Interview

This round lasted 1 hour and involved a backtracking + combinations question. Unfortunately, I don’t remember the exact problem since I hadn’t come across a similar one on LeetCode before. The interviewer seemed satisfied with my approach.

#### Round 3: Tech Interview (LLD)

I was given a Low-Level Design (LLD) problem for an Online Stock Brokerage System. The focus was mainly on implementing a feature to fetch the Top N stocks traded in the last 1 hour (trending stocks).

- Discussed requirements in detail.
- Explored trade-offs between different data structures for tracking top stocks.
- Implemented the solution and made changes based on the interviewer's suggestions.

The interviewer was satisfied with the final approach. This round also lasted 1 hour.

#### Final Result

After two weeks, I received a call from HR confirming my selection! 🎉

Find the compensation details here - [https://leetcode.com/discuss/post/6513864/zeta-sde1-on-campus-feb-2025-offer-by-an-265l/](https://leetcode.com/discuss/post/6513864/zeta-sde1-on-campus-feb-2025-offer-by-an-265l/)

title: JP Morgan & Chase (JPMC) | Java Developer - SD2 (SDE2) | Bangalore [Offer]
summary:
Previous Title: SDE2 at Airbus
Location: BangaloreOnline Assessment | Nov, 2024:
Two easy-medium questions - solved both questions, could be optimized more, but it passed all tests so I submitted
Verdict: I got a call within a week saying I passed an
content:
**Previous Title:** SDE2 at Airbus
**Location:** Bangalore


**Online Assessment | Nov, 2024:**
Two easy-medium questions - solved both questions, could be optimized more, but it passed all tests so I submitted
Verdict: I got a call within a week saying I passed and was asked some basic details about my current company, position, compensation and expectation


**Interview D-day | Nov, 2024:**
Consisted of 3 rounds of 50 mins each. Irrespective of performance all 3 rounds will happen
Platform: HackerRank


**Round 1: System Design**
Taken by a very experienced and technically sound member of JPMC
Improve the system design of Google Drive-like system
I was given a skeleton of the basic components like load balancer, file fetching service, user service, S3 DB. I had to add/optimize the components needed to make the system robust and scalable.
The round was quite good. Although I covered a lot of concepts, the interviewer expected me to focus a bit more on the scalability aspect using some event streaming service.
Felt like: 7.5/10


**Round 2: Behavioural / Managerial Round**
Introduction
Basic explanation of my current work
Situational based behavioral questions
Concepts Involved: Conflict resolution, teamwork, ethics & morality, outlook on feedback
The conversation went smoothly so I had a good feeling about this round.
Felt like: 9.5/10


**Round 3: DSA & Code Review**


DSA: Count the number of duplicates in an array
I used a HashMap in Java


Code Review: There was a big chunk of code which just works in production, but will have very bad coding standard.
Concepts involved: OOPs, static, volatile, basic code writing standards


Felt pretty good about this round, except that I had to submit the DSA question twice because I didn't consider that there could be more than 1 duplicate, but I quickly understood and made the change and the discussion was smooth. Also I had some trouble with the volatile keyword during code review.
Felt like: 9/10


**Final Verdict:** Selected. Within 2-3 days, I got a call from the recruiter/hr who said I got good reviews and was selected for SD2. It followed a discussion with HR about the compensation and I received the offer in second week Dec accordingly.


**Compensation details:** https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6218673/JP-Morgan-and-Chase-(JPMC)-or-SD2-or-Bangalore-or-Offer

title: 💻 Interview Experience – Paytm
summary: \uD83D\uDCBB Interview Experience \u2013 Paytm\n\nI recently went through the interview process for a software role at Paytm, and it was an insightful and rewar
content:
💻 **Interview Experience – Paytm**

I recently went through the interview process for a software role at Paytm, and it was an insightful and rewarding experience. Here's a breakdown of the rounds:

🔹 **Round 1: HackerRank Test**

Two Easy-to-Medium level DSA problems (focused on HashMap & Arrays).
Multiple-choice questions covering DSA concepts and problem-solving techniques.

🔹 **Round 2: Technical Interview with a Senior Software Engineer**

Solved a DSA problem on HashMap, optimizing it for better efficiency.
Discussions on Core Java, Multithreading, Spring Boot, SQL queries and monitoring tools like Grafana & Prometheus.

🔹 **Round 3: Interview with the AVP (Technical + Hiring Manager)**

Deep dive into my resume and past experiences.
Discussions on Redis, Multithreading, and QuickSort-based DSA problems.
A broader conversation about the team’s work, technical challenges, and future opportunities.

**After clearing the interviews, I was shortlisted for the role, and HR reached out to discuss compensation.** 🎉

However, I am not joining Paytm for now as I am currently working at **Razorpay** and enjoying my time here. The work culture, learning opportunities, and team environment at Razorpay have been excellent. That said, the Paytm interview process was an enriching experience, and I appreciate the opportunity to engage with such talented professionals.

Would be happy to discuss any part of this process in detail with anyone preparing for similar roles! 🚀

title: (Don't interview with) Paytm | SSE | Unprofessional and Unethical
summary:
Current - SDE2 at a Banking company
Fixed: 20 LPA
Experience: 3+ years

I recently interviewed with Paytm for SSE role and had clearly communicated the recr
content:
Current - SDE2 at a Banking company
Fixed: 20 LPA
Experience: 3+ years

I recently interviewed with Paytm for SSE role and had clearly communicated the recruiter about the offers I was currently holding. Even after clearing all the rounds with highest ratings (I got to know later), they made me wait for more than a week, eventually to tell me that the company has recently made a policy to not offer more than 30% hike on the current compensation irrespective of the offers a candidate holds (contradictory from what the recruiter communicated earlier).

While I appreciate and respect the policies a company abides by, they should not really waste a candidate's time especially when they are serving their notice period already and they could spend this precious time interviewing with other companies.

Now, they have just stepped back and not even making an offer, and the recruiter just ended the call saying - "we are sorry".

Guys, paytm as a company is just going down (heard from their current employees as well regarding appraisals, promotions, etc) and if they keep perfoming like this, they are surely going to lose on a lot of good talent. 

If you are already in the 20 LPA range and expecting anything even slighly above 26 LPA, please do not waste your precious time interviewing with them. Extremely unprofessional and unethical procedures.

summary:
Hi everyone, I recently got an offer from Walmart for a Java Developer (SWE 3) role and wanted to share the details:Current Company:
Indian e-commerce company
Education: NIT Warangal (Non Cs back ground)
Experience: 2 years 9 months
Current CTC: ₹17.
content:
Hi everyone, I recently got an offer from Walmart for a Java Developer (SWE 3) role and wanted to share the details:

Current Company:
Indian e-commerce company
Education: NIT Warangal (Non Cs back ground)
Experience: 2 years 9 months
Current CTC: ₹17.64L (₹16L base + ₹1.64L variable)
Walmart Offer:
Total CTC: ₹28.43L
Fixed: ₹19.91L (₹19L base + ₹91K PF)
Variable: ₹3.8L
RSU: ₹4.75L (vested over 3 years )
Plus, Walmart benefits
It’s a solid offer, but I feel I might have been lowballed after hearing others in the ₹32-35L range. Since I'm joining in April, my RSUs won’t vest for a year, but i get variable payment from my prev company :-).One reason I accepted the offer without much negotiation is that I got selected within just a month of seriously applying. The funny part is, I actually got selected for Walmart twice! But by the time the second recruiter reached out, I had already received the first offer, so I only had one chance to negotiate.Would love to hear your thoughts, especially from Walmartians!

title: Gojek SSE offer (bangalore)
summary:
Hi, Super dissapointed but I feel people should know.
After 2 months of giving multiple rounds of interviews with Gojek Bangalore.
And 3 weeks of waiting to hea
content:
Hi, Super dissapointed but I feel people should know.
After 2 months of giving multiple rounds of interviews with Gojek Bangalore.
And 3 weeks of waiting to hear back from them. They came back with an offer.

Current Comp:
yoe: 4.5
Fixed: 16LPA
Variable: 20%
One time bonus: 1Lac



Goejk SSE Offer
Base: 30LPA
Variable: 10%
(some reimbursements that I don't really care much about. Who cannot afford internet)


The recruiter was very adament on only giving the offer based on my current comp. Which is why that number. I'm pretty confident the interviews went well. My current comp sucks which is why I want to leave, but that doesn't mean my next should also suck.
I expected much more. Maybe I had the wrong expectations from Gojek.
I don't think the offer is even fair to the interview process. 


Any thoughts, suggesitions, negotiation tips? What should I say/ask? Am I just overreacting?


interview experience : https://leetcode.com/discuss/post/6371415/gojek-sse-by-anonymous_user-jkml/

Title/Level: Software En
content:

Years of Experience: 7 months at a fintech MNC
Date of the Offer: Feb 2025
Company: PhonePe
Title/Level: Software Engineer (PhonePe has flat hierarchy)
Location: Bangalore (5 days WFO)
Salary: 19.25L
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 3L
Stock bonus: ESOPS: 8.5L vested over 4 years
Bonus: None
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 22.25L + ESOPS 
Benefits: Standard PhonePe Benefits
Other details: Tried to negotiate but the recruiter won't budge.

I feel like this offer is a low-ball given that they already offer 5L joining bonus on-campus. Negotiation can work only if I have a counter-offer which I don't currently have. I'm trying to get another offer in the meanwhile. Is there anything else that the community recommends?

UPDATE:

Negotiated with the recruiter with an expecting offer (didn't have one though). I sensed their desperatiion to close the position and stood my ground with the negotiation. So to make sure that I don't ditch them later with some other offer, they increased the numbers:

Salary: 20L (Matched the base)
Signing Bonus: 5L
Stock Bonus: 8.5 L over 4 years
TC: 25L + ESOPS (1st year)
Verdict: Accepted

title: Seimens Healthineers vs STG Labs Offer
summary: Over the past two years, I have been employed in a healthcare-based mid-sized startup in Begalore. My compensation was fixed at 16 LPA, and I accumulated a tota
content:
Over the past two years, I have been employed in a healthcare-based mid-sized startup in Begalore. My compensation was fixed at 16 LPA, and I accumulated a total of four years of experience. Recently, I have received job offers for a Senior Software Engineer position from both Siemens Healthineers and Software Engineer from STG Labs.


**Siemens Senior Software Role Level 9:**
Compensation: 22 LPA, fully fixed


**STG Labs (Simphony Technology Group Labs):**
Compensation: 25 LPA, fully fixed
Role: Software Engineer

However, they have agreed to reclassify the role to Senior Engineer on the day of joining via email.
In terms of organization, Siemens Healthineers appears to be a more reputable company, and I believe they offer a better work-life balance. However, I am concerned about the potential legacy of their technology stack. STG Labs has a more advanced technology stack, but it is not as large as Siemens. There is a compensation difference as well any inputs will be appricaited which can help me out in choosing the offer.
author: code_stormer

Should I take it?

title: Adobe | Computer Scientist - 1 | Dec 2024 [Offer]
summary:
Status: B.Tech (Tier-3)
Position: SDE-1 at FAANG
Experience: 3.5 years


APPLICATION

Applied on careers portal for Member of Technical Staff - 2 roles
content:
```
Status: B.Tech (Tier-3)
Position: SDE-1 at FAANG
Experience: 3.5 years
```

**APPLICATION**

Applied on careers portal for Member of Technical Staff - 2 roles with referral. Recruiter reached out in few days to discuss preliminary details like compensation expectation, reason to switch, etc. 

**ROUND-1** 

There were a couple of behavioral questions from resume related to current work experience.

Two Sum - Given an integer array and a target, find the two numbers such that their sum is equal to target. Was asked to write code with my own judgement on which optimal approach should be used.

Binary Tree Mirror Image - Given a binary tree, print the mirror image of tree. The interviewer expected to write both recursive and iterative solutions. 

**ROUND-2** 

Very detailed discussion and coding of the internal implementation of hashmap such as rehashing, load factor, hash code calculation, collision handling, worst case time complexity, generic keys and values, etc. The areas of improvement and possible optimization approaches. 

**ROUND-3** 

Middle Stack - Implementation of stack data structure that should additionally support get middle, insert middle and delete middle operations. All stack operations (standard + additional) should take O(1) time complexity.

Producer Consumer Problem - There's a restaurant in which there are mutiple people who can take order, serve order and cook food. These people are working in parallel. Write the code to correctly simulate the entire behavior taking into conseridation the race condition and overflow. The follow-ups were related to auto-scaling, infinite capacity of each group of workers, etc.

**ROUND-4**

What exactly happens when we encounter a program crash? How does a crashed program affect other programs? How can crash be prevented? Will the prevention mechanisms fool-proof the program from crash? What loop holes will still remain which can lead to the crash?

How would you convert an event-driven system into an API based system? [It was related to my current project hence I can't really share the details here] 

Given there are thousands of railway stations and trains are scheduled from one station to another. These trains may pass through mutiple railway stations during the journey. Explain the thought process and various approaches in case people would want to query which trains are going to pass through a particular railway station. 

Standard HM questions like reasons for job switch, why Adobe, etc.

**Offer**

The recruiter reached out in a couple of days saying I've been upgraded from MTS-2 to CS-1 role due to my salary expectations and positive outcome of interview rounds. 

**Compensation** - https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6135295/Adobe-or-Computer-Scientist-1-or-Dec-2024

title: Razorpay | Frontend Engineer
summary: There were a total of three rounds:\n1) Machine Coding Round (React.js) \u2013 This round lasted 1.5 hours. I was asked to create a reusable dropdown component
content:
There were a total of three rounds:
1) Machine Coding Round (React.js) – This round lasted 1.5 hours. I was asked to create a reusable dropdown component with search functionality. The focus was on making it modular and reusable, with several follow ups around performance optimization, especially for handling large datasets.

2) Hiring Manager Round – This round was intended to last 1 hour but ended in 45 minutes. The interviewer explained the role and team structure, primarily discussing my current and past work. Few questions based on my resume and reason to join Razorpay.

3) UI Tech / Web Fundamentals / JavaScript Round – The interviewer asked me to explain one of my past projects, the technical challenges I faced, and the reasoning behind my technical decisions. Throughout the discussion, there were multiple follow-up questions. Later, they asked in-depth Web Fundamentals questions (e.g., Service Workers, CORS, CRP, REST API, HTTP caching, JavaScript script loading etc.). We also discussed how to create a custom hook that returns true if a component is mounted and false otherwise. In the end, I was asked to explain all the React hooks I knew.

Offer: https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6398965/Razorpay-or-Frontend-engineer-or-Bangalore

title: Google L3 Interview Experience | India | Offer
summary: I recently interviewed with Google for L3 role and got the offer. As I found Leetcode's community very helpful while I was preparing, I thought of giving back to it by writing this.I have around 1.5 years of experience in the industry.Application:I a
content:
I recently interviewed with Google for L3 role and got the offer. As I found Leetcode's community very helpful while I was preparing, I thought of giving back to it by writing this.

I have around 1.5 years of experience in the industry.

# **Application:**
I applied for 3 roles with referral around mid of September 2024. Out of which 2 applications got rejected and I got a call back for one of the applications around mid of November 2024. My LC count was around 450 when 2 of my applications got rejected. I was solving problems on LC to get my touch back on DSA and got the count around 550 in November 2024. I do believe adding a good LC or any coding profile link in your resume will get you a call as Google's interviews for L3 and L4 are purely based on DSA.

# HR call:
The recruiter reached out to me via mail and asked for my updated CV. Followed by a short call on Gmeet, explaining the Google's interview process. I was asked some basic questions on DSA and how do I rate myself on DSA out of 10. I was asked my coding language preference. I used Java in all my coding rounds. Just bragged for some 15 minutes and moved forward to scheduling initial phone screen. My recruiter gave me 3 weeks to brush up on DSA and scheduled the phone screen on early December 2024.

# Phone Screen:
The interviewer was from Hyderabad, India office. He greeted me and introduced himself. He said he's also a Noogler (New to Google) and asked me to introduce myself. I kept my introduction very brief to save as much of time as possible to solve the problems.

**First problem:**
https://leetcode.com/problems/minimum-area-rectangle/description/
**Follow up:**
https://leetcode.com/problems/minimum-area-rectangle-ii/description/

Instead of minimum area, I was asked to return largest area possible in both the problems.

I explained the optimal approach for first problem and coded the solution within 10 minutes. Then I was asked to come up with the approach for the follow up. He didn't want me to code it. I explained the optimal approach for follow up as well. Whole interview got wrapped up within 25 minutes.

I got the feedback from my recruiter very next day. I was told the feedback was very positive and we are moving to onsite interviews. Onsite has 4 interviews, out of which 3 interviews are DSA based and 1 interview is Googlyness (Behavioral). I wanted to get done with all my interviews within new year, but due to vacation season, we were not able to schedule the interviews till new year. I got my interviews scheduled around mid of January 2025.

# Onsite 1:

The interviewer was from Bangalore, India office. He introduced himself and asked for my introduction. He was very clear that he will give me only 30 mins to solve the problems as he wanted 5 mins for introduction and 10 mins for any questions to ask him.

**First problem:**
Given an english paragraph and an integer "width", return minimum number of lines we need to print the paragraph. I was not given any example IO and was expected to come up with my own. I asked some clarifying questions like whether a word could break from a line or not. He said the word could break. Then I came up with below example and clarified if my output was correct.

```
paragraph: "I'm giving Google interview for L3 role"
width: 9

output: 5
```

I explained the brute force and also the optimal approach. He asked me to code both the solutions. I coded the same.

**First follow up:**
Now the words should not break from a line. I clarified one possible edge case like what if there is any word in the paragraph which has more letters than the given width. He said I can assume that the width is always equal or greater than the longest word in the paragraph. I took the same example and clarified the output. Also do we need to print the space character if it's the first character of the line. He said if any line starts with a space, we need to ignore the space.

```
paragraph: "I'm giving Google interview for L3 role"
width: 9

output: 6
```

I explained the optimal approach and coded the same. He asked me if we could optimize this somewhere. I know there's no possible optimization on time as I was very sure that my approach was in the best BigO possible for this problem. I found an area to optimize on space, optimized the same by modifying the code.

**Second follow up:**
https://leetcode.com/discuss/post/1423422/google-phone-screen-by-sharmapriyanka269-ul7w/

He explained me the problem verbally and gave the example IO for this problem. We had only 2 mins left from the 30mins problem solving window. The moment he pasted the example IO, binary search striked to my mind and I explained the same. He nodded, closed the codepad, and asked me if I have any questions for him. I asked him whether my binary search approach was correct and optimal, he said YES :)

# Onsite 2: (Googlyness)

The interviewer was from Europe. I expected some behavioral questions, but all the questions were work related. Some of the questions are,

1) Tell me about a time where your proposed solution for a problem was not agreed by your manager.
2) Tell me about a time where you had to work with a new team and how your contributions to the new team added value to the customer.
3) How would you react if you're about to join a new team and all the members in the team are way more senior and experienced than you ?
4) Tell me about a time where your proposed solution had some problems and your senior pointed it out.
5) Did you start implementing the feature for the proposed solution that had a problem (Follow up in 4th question).

I forgot other couple of questions. For all the negative scenario, I explained in a way that I had some alternative solution that would work. I didn't prepare much as I was expecting behavioral questions like conflict in team, etc. But then I somehow got away and managed to satisfy the interviewer.

# Onsite 3:

The interviewer was from US. She greeted me with a smiling face and talked about herself and her team. She talked to me for some 3 minutes, mentioning that we would have an icebreaker session.

**First problem:**
Given an array of integers, find the Longest Increasing Subsequence with difference between adjacent elements as 1.

Explained both O(n^2) and O(n) and coded the optimal one.

**First follow up:**
Given an array of integers, find the Longest Increasing Subsequence with difference between adjacent elements atmost k. k is given.

Explained the O(nk) approach. She asked whether this could be optimized. I talked about segment tree and explained the approach. When I took the white paper to draw the segment tree to explain it in a better way, she stopped me right away and asked me to implement O(nk), saying she just wanted to know whether I could optimize it using a segment tree and that she wasn't going to ask me to implement the segment tree for the sake of this interview, which was only 45 minutes long. I coded the O(nk) solution.

**Second follow up:**
Same as first problem, but instead of returning just LIS as an integer, need to return the LIS list, which contains the indices of the elements in LIS.

Explained the optimal solution and coded the same. I finished coding all 3 problems exactly on 45th minute of the interview. She ended the interview officially and was talking with me for some 20 minutes. She was sorry for extending this to another 20 minutes as she wanted to give me a chance to talk to her about her experience and Google. **Such good interviewers deserve a spot bonus !!**

# Onsite 4:
The interviewer was from US. She jumped into the problem statement directly. 
https://leetcode.com/discuss/post/4263604/google-onsite-round-1-by-adityakan750-niib/

Same problem was divided into two parts.

**First problem:**
Don't need to care about the colors of the houses.

**First follow up:**
Handle with the colors of the houses.

Explained the optimal approach and coded the same for both the parts. The follow up part was more like a design problem, I created a class for house and handled the colors. Interviewer mentioned that I could choose the output format as I wish.

# Feedback Call:
I got the feedback after 3 days from my last onsite round. Generally it would take atleast a week to get feedback, but my interviews were cancelled and got rescheduled 4 times due to interviewer's unavailability. These reschedules made the process a bit longer. I think because of this, my recruiter got the feedback for the interviews that happened early.

I was told that my feedback is very strong, especially in all my DSA rounds. Then I got a team fit call scheduled the very next day.

# TeamFit Call:
This went more like a discussion. The manager introduced himself and explained about the work and the team. I was asked about the techs I worked on and some questions.

1) Let's say you're about to work on new teckstack. Will you be able to ramp up much faster ? Will you be able to learn as well as work on those techs parallely ?
2) Talk about any interesting or challenging feature you've worked on.
3) Why are you leaving your org and why do you want to join Google ?
4) You have 1.5 yoe and if you continue with your org, you will get a promotion in next 6 months. But if you join Google as an L3, it might take another 1.5 years for a promotion. What do you think about this ?

# Comp Discussion and Offer
I got a call from my recruiter after 3 days from my teamfit call to check my availability for the compensation discussion. I was not asked about my current compensation. I didn't give any other interviews and had no offers with me. I didn't negotiate and accepted the offer as the initial numbers were itself great. Offer got rolled out on the same day!

[Compensation Details](https://leetcode.com/discuss/post/6541970/google-l3-swe-2-india-by-rvishwaa-51dm/)

# Preparation:
I'm kind of good at problem solving from my college days, as I used to  give contest on Codeforces and Codechef. I didn't do much LC on my college days. I started grinding LC only after I decided to give it a try for Google. 

CP is not necessary to crack Google as all the problems I was asked were LC medium, medium-hard type of problems. But then CP experience will come handy in interviews as it widen our thought process in a large scale and we will be aware of the value of every minute that goes past in a contest. Contest are again kind of similar to interview setup. But then you gotta explain your thoughts and think out loud in an interview. I used to take DSA sessions to my juniors when I was in college. I think this helped me a lot, to put my thoughts into words and explain it to others in a way they could understand easily.

Try to give contest in LC. While solving, try explaing the solution to yourself. Also, practice to code your solutions on Google Docs.

title: Target | L5 | Bengaluru [Offer - Feb 13]
summary:
A recruiter contacted me via LinkedIn regarding the opportunity.
Round 1: Hiring Manager (HM) Screening

Had a discussion with the hiring manager. About 50%
content:
A recruiter contacted me via LinkedIn regarding the opportunity.
Round 1: **Hiring Manager (HM) Screening**

Had a discussion with the hiring manager. About 50% of the questions were behavioral, while the remaining focused on my current project.
Verdict: Cleared
Round 2: **Pair Programming**

A panel consisting of two members conducted the interview. It started with Java Spring Boot questions, followed by a coding task where they shared a repository. I had to:


Explain the logic (it involved reading a large CSV file and processing it).
Fix bugs.
Optimize the code (reduce turnaround time).
Apply design patterns.
Implement asynchronous reading.


Verdict: Cleared
Round 3: **High-Level Design (HLD)**

The interview began with an in-depth discussion about my current project (which is similar to the "Top K Heavy Hitters" problem). We had a detailed conversation about various aspects of it. The interviewer was interested in many areas and asked about every detail.

Next, I was asked to explain the internal workings of Kafka and various Kafka-based scenarios. There was also some discussion about my hobby projects.

Verdict: Cleared
Round 4: **Hiring Manager Round**

This was supposed to be a behavioral round but turned out to be completely technical.

The interviewer asked me to design a package delivery system with trucks, ensuring optimized load distribution. We then discussed my current project and various trade-offs involved.

Verdict: **Hire**


Compensation details: https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6411020/Target-India-or-L5-or-Bengaluru

Curr
content:
```
College - Tier 2, 2023 Passout - CSE branch
Experience - 1 year 5 months at startup, excluding internship.
Current Designation - **Software Engineer**
Current Compensation - 15 base + 1.5L year end bonus + 5000 units esops (vesting over 4 years 25% each with 1 year cliff)
First Year compensation at current company = 16.5L + 1250 units stock options

Current Offers (based on date of offers in ascending order):
1. **IBM - Backend Developer**
    Location - Kochi, Kerala
    Compensation - 16L base, 2L bonus (1L in first month and 1L in 13th month with 1 year clawback each)
    No stocks
    Date of offer - will update
    First Year compensation = 16 + 1 = 17L

2. **LambdaTest - MTS [Software Engineer]**
    Location - Noida
    Compensation - 22L base = Total CTC 22L
    No joining bonus, No retention bonus, No stocks
    Date of offer - will update
    First Year compensation = 22L

3. **MindTickle - SDE1**
    Location - Pune
    Compensation - 25L base + 1L JB (1 year clawback) + 10% retention bonus (2.5L) + 1000 units esops (vesting over 4 years 25% each with 1 year cliff)
    Date of offer - will update
    First Year compensation = 28.5L (25 + 1 + 2.5) + 250 units of stock options
```
There were other offers as well but I think those were not adding significant value so skipped them (this also includes the ones that ghosted me at any stage). After the lambdatest offer, my current company did counter (and honestly, I was about to stay back). But, while negotiating I got the offer from MindTickle and moved on. The offer from MindTickle would have been a bit on lower side if I didn't had competing offers and if I was not on notice period.

I was looking for a good company since May-June 2024, got rejected at multiple companies and honestly the market seem to be in a bad phase as of now (not sure how others feel about this). Most of the good offers came to me not by applying rather the HR directly reached out over mail or Linkedin (I would say I was lucky here). But, parallely I was applying to my target companies one after another improving my resume after each rejection. And what helped me most at the interviews was my diverse profile that I got working at my current startup in multiple domains.

Rejected IBM due to low balled offer and location. Rejected Lambdatest as they were not ready to give ESOPs even though they are a startup (this is based on my own principle where I join a startup only when they give ESOPs, others might think differently).

I'm not sure of the value of ESOPs of MindTickle at this point. [I don't believe HRs on this front]. Still, since its  series E funded startup 1000 units looked good to me. **It would be of great help if someone can help me know the current value of these shares!!**

I'll post the interview experiences soon.

title: Coinbase IC4 | India | Offer
summary:
I applied through LinkedIn in Jan 2025.

Round 1 - Logical Reasoning OA
Basic Math questions and image pattern recognition questions

Round 2 - Code Signal
content:
I applied through LinkedIn in Jan 2025.

**Round 1 - Logical Reasoning OA**
Basic Math questions and image pattern recognition questions

**Round 2 - Code Signal OA**
Key Value Store implementation which can have 2 keys. There were 4 levels.  I don't remember all the questions exactly.
It's somewhat similar to Timemap question on leetcode but you will have 2 keys here.
https://leetcode.com/problems/time-based-key-value-store/description/

Example:
key1, sub_key1, timestamp = val1
key1, sub_key2, timestamp = val2
Questions were like :
return all values of key1
return latest value for key1, sub_key1
return value for key1, sub_key1 at a given timestamp
delete key
delete subkey

**Round 3 - Foundational Interview**
General Behavioral Round questions

**Round 4 -  Tech Execution Interview**
*Level 1:*
Write an alternate iterator for list of lists. Similar to ZigZag Iterator on leetcode but you can have not just 2 but 'n' lists within the list;
https://leetcode.com/problems/zigzag-iterator/description/

Example :
lists = [[0, 1, 2], [], [3, 4], [5]]
output should be 0, 3, 5, 1, 4, 2

*Level 2:*
Write a range iterator. Should support negative step as well.
Example :
start = 0
end = 10
step = 2
output should be [0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10]

*Level 3:*
Write a basic list iterator
list = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
output should be 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5

*Level 4:*
Modify the class written in level1 to take list of iterator objects instead of lists and print the numbers in alternate fashion. The iterators list can contain both range iterator and list iterator.

**Round 5 - Domain Interview**
You will be given a list of transactions. You need to write a generic search api to filter on a combination of specific fields and values
Example :
transactions = [
{id: 1, time: 1, userId: 1, amount: 10},
{id: 2, time: 2, userId: 3, amount: 10},
{id: 3, time: 3, userId: 4, amount: 11},
{id: 4, time: 4, userId: 2, amount: 12},
]
Filters should support operations like "=", ">", "<" etc
The question is open ended. You need to decide how the input should look like. 

*Follow up :*
Explain pagination and why we need it?
What are some of the techniques used for pagination?
How do you choose a cursor id column when using cursor based pagination?
Enhance your code to support cursor based pagination.

The interviewers were really nice. They were helping me whenever I got stuck. The recruiter too was good. He frequently gave me updates and feedback.

Compensation Details : https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6413423/Coinbase-or-IC4-or-Bengaluru

title: Avalara | SSE | Nov 2024 [Offer]
summary:
Status: B.Tech (Tier-3)
Position: SDE-1 at FAANG
Experience: 3+ years


APPLICATION

Applied on career portal and recruiter reached out after some days
content:
```
Status: B.Tech (Tier-3)
Position: SDE-1 at FAANG
Experience: 3+ years
```

**APPLICATION**

Applied on career portal and recruiter reached out after some days to schedule interviews.

**ROUND-1 : Cognitive Assessment [25 mins]** 

The test was in following parts -
* Cognitive Assessment - 15 mins
* Personality Test - 10 mins

**ROUND-2 : Technical Assesment [60 mins]**

DSA - 

Given an array of integers and K, find the kth largest number in each iteration. In first iteration the first k elements are selected, in 2nd iteration one more element is selected and so on. I solved the question using priority queue, working solution was expected that should pass all the 12 test cases.

CS Fundamentals - 

* What is the difference between SQL and NoSQL?
* What all data stuctures you know and have used?
* Explain polymorphism.
* Explain dependency injection and it's benefits.
* How to ensure security of your services/code? 
* What is singleton design pattern, it's implementation and use cases?
* Explain unit testing using Junit along with mockito.
* How would you implement auto-scaling of your services?

**ROUND-3 : Hiring Manager [60 mins]**

* Detailed discussion on current project, impact, challenges, etc.
* What mistakes have you done in past and what was the learning?
* What are some proud achievements related to work?
* Why do you want to leave your current job?
* Why chose Avalara?

**ROUND-4 : Technical + Hiring Manager [60 mins] (Extra Round for Higher Band)**

* Explain your thought process on how to design parking management system? A detailed system design wasn't expected but design of APIs and database schema was enough.
* Why do you want to leave your current job?
* Why chose Avalara?
* Are you ready to work on C# and other tech?  

Received the offer after Round-3 in 2 hours but they scheduled Round-4 after one day to move me to higher band of SSE due to my high compensation expectations. I rejected the offer due to low bar of hiring.

**Compensation:** https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6093936/Avalara-or-SSE-or-Nov-2024

title: Job Offer Dilemma - Seeking Advice
summary: Hi everyone, I'm looking for some advice. I joined a company (a service-based company) a month ago, and my onboarding to the client is complete.  During my job search, I had interviewed with HP Inc. for a position that was on hold at the time. I info
content:
Hi everyone, I'm looking for some advice. I joined a company (a service-based company) a month ago, and my onboarding to the client is complete.  During my job search, I had interviewed with HP Inc. for a position that was on hold at the time. I informed the HP recruiter that I was joining another company.

However, yesterday the HP recruiter contacted me and said my interview feedback was excellent. They offered me the position without any further interviews.  I told them I had already joined another company and would have to serve a 90-day notice period. They agreed to this.We discussed salary, they initially said the previously discussed amount was fine.Then I asked if they could increase it, and they offered an additional 2 lakhs.
so My current salary at the service-based company is 4 lakhs less than what HP has offered.

Now I'm in a dilemma. Should I consider this offer? If so, should i negotiate much more on salary?because I feel I might be underpaid according to the market rate.

What are the potential negative consequences of serving a 90-day notice period after just one month at the company?

title: Dream11 | SDE2 | Mumbai | Dec 2024 [Offer]
summary:
Round 1 - DSA - 60 minutes - Oct 2024
2 leetcode mediums
1. Connected components + DFS related question. Coded optmised solution in first 20 mins
2. Question
content:
### Round 1 - DSA - 60 minutes - Oct 2024
2 leetcode mediums
1. Connected components + DFS related question. Coded optmised solution in first 20 mins
2. Question related to prefix sum. Provided bruteforce solution. Required some hints from the interviewer to reach the optimised solution. Just finished in 30 mins.

Recruiter reached out after a week and infomed about the next round.

### Round 2 - Database - 60 minutes - Nov 2024
This round focussed only on datastores and it's internals.
1. What's the most challenging project/feature you've worked on?
2. How would you carry out database migration, from one SQL vendor to another SQL vendor. (reply: 2 parallel writes, distributed transactions)
3. 2 phase commit - is it really practical? how would you handle coordinator failure?
6. Database sharding strategies
7. Database Replication problems, how to deal with leader failure, discussion on eventual consistency.
8. How does book my show prevent 2 users from selecting the same seat? Discussion on isolation levels.
5. Scaling out an overloaded kafka queue. How would you know the queue is under load? How would you lessen the load - rebalancing strategies. (bombed here :P)

Was surprised at how much in-depth they expected the answers to be.
Recruiter reached out after a week and informed of next rounds to be conducted in person in Mumbai office. Flights to and fro arranged for the same day.

### Round 3 - onsite rounds in Mumbai - Nov 2024

##### Round 3.1 - system design - 90 minutes
Design a stock broker. You figure out the requirements (functional/non functional), expected load, concurrency, resiliency and proceed.
Every design choice was faced with critical WHYs and HOWs and alternatives. Interviewers had great technical know-how.

##### Round 3.2 - HM round - 45 minutes
Resume based questions, discussion on SDLC lifecycle, scenario based questions

##### Round 3.3 - HR - 30 minutes
General discussions on life, CTC expectation, etc

---------
compensation: https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6388927/Dream11-or-SDE2-or-Mumbai

content:
Status: 4.5 yrs experience; working as an SSE at a top e-commerce platform in India
Position: Software Engineer at PropertyFinder
Location: Dubai, UAE
Date: January 2025

Applied via Employee Referral.

Introductory Call with HR : Brief about the process, questions about experience and motivation to join PropertyFinder and moving to Dubai

Technical Phone Screen Round : Leetcode Medium question based on calculations on prefix sum
Verdict : Selected for onsite rounds

All 3 onsite rounds were scheduled for the same day. 

R1 (Component/Class Design) : 
- UML diagram for a parking lot management system and explaination of the whole flow. 
- Cross questioning on decisions made and how we can extend certain functionality - like introduction of role based discounts etc.

R2 (DSA) : 
- Sum of 2 numbers stored as linked lists
- SAGA design pattern in distributed system and how does it work (since I was working on an orchestration service in my current org)

R3(System Design + HM) : 
- Design a ride hailing app like Uber/Careem. Cross Questioning about design decisions. How will we fetch driver location at high scale? How can we search for nearest riders (small explanation of the ways to search) 
- Why do you want to join PropertyFinder and what are you looking for in your role?
- Tell me about a situation where you had to handle conflict with other teammates. (Used STAR framework)

Verdict : SELECTED

title: URGENT HELP NEEDED | How to get a company to pay as close as possible to its budget
summary: Hi Everyone, \nI have 4 years of experience. Currently interviewing with multiple companies. My last compensation was 15 LPA Fixed. I have an offer for 31 LPA F
content:
Hi Everyone, 
I have 4 years of experience. Currently interviewing with multiple companies. My last compensation was 15 LPA Fixed. I have an offer for 31 LPA Fixed. A company that I am interviewing with (let's say, X) has a max budget of 45 LPA Fixed as per Glassdoor and Leetcode. I am inclined the most towards X. This company is having its interview process proceed rather quickly than the other companies in pipeline. 
My aim was to get counter offers of 35 LPA first, then a 40 LPA on this and present this offer to X to get it as close as possible to its budget. However, the pace at which X is going, it seems that it would wrap up its process before the others in pipeline (and hence would present its offer before the rest, if things go well). How do I navigate this situation?
Can I refuse to share my last compensation with X and just share my expectations depending on how well my interviews go? I have heard a few people go about like this. Folks having experience with negotiations, please share your views.

PS : Will share the companies and interview experiences with them later.

title: Atlassian | Senior Software Engineer | Offer
summary: Round 1: Third party\u2028Scenario questions (20 min)\n\nMusic streaming servers are set on consistent hashing. What are the issues with it?\u2028Pro and cons o
content:
**Round 1: Third party** Scenario questions (20 min)

Music streaming servers are set on consistent hashing. What are the issues with it? Pro and cons of pre-loaded in hints and server loaded hints for an app Process large file on a single system which is larger than RAM on that system Sports news classification service where the system would download the article and apply ML to detect biasness. What information is needed for resource estimate Moving a production ready app to beyond 1 country. What all things need to be done in backend Coding round (30 min) Q1) Words = ["baby", "cat", "dada", "dog"] Find if any word in the list can be formed by a given word word1 = ctay find(words, word1) => cat word2 = dad find(words, word2) => -

Some 8 test cases were available.

Q2) Given a 2D matrix of char. Find the word if it exists in the matrix where you can move only down or right. Only approach is needed in this question

**Round 2: Data Structures** Each file has a collectionId attached to it Generate a report to show total size of the files and top N collections by size Scale up to include multiple collections per file How would you handle this in a multithreaded env

**Round 3: Code Design** Design a rate limiter where each user can perform max of X requests in Y seconds Scale up to include credit system for that user per unused requests How would you handle this in a multithreaded env

**Round 4: System Design** Design a web scraper Provided with initial set of URLs Scrape all possible nested urls and find images in all urls and return the list against parent url Multiple followups

**Round 5: Managerial** Questions around situations how I handled a project with vague requirements How I helped a team member grow Conflict with manager

**Round 6: Values** Questions around Atlassian values

Do not take Managerial and Values round lightly. These are pretty serious for P50+ roles and can downgrade or reject the candidates based on these 2 rounds. Overall the experience took around 1.5 months and 1 week from verbal offer to an actual one. When the HC said yes, multiple Hiring managers were interested in my profile. Took a team match call with 2 of them to decide the team I would be joining.

Comp details: https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6326155/Atlassian-or-P50-or-Senior-Software-Engineer

summary:

Recrutier reached out to me via phone call and then roun
content:
Education: B.Tech CSE from NIT
Position: SWE at PhonePe
Location: Bengaluru
Experience: 3.5 years

Recrutier reached out to me via phone call and then rounds were scheduled.

**Round 1** : Machine coding round
**Experience** : Hackkerrank problem based on OOPS concept, needed to write a lot of code and everything was expected to be working and passing all test cases.
***Design order management system***
needed to design cart functionalities, calculating total cart value, etc,
working code was expected, needed to pass all 13/13 test cases to proceed further,
interviewer was chilled out but still you always need to think out loud.

**Round 2** : Low Level Design (APIs | DB Schema | DTOs | Follow ups) were expected
**Experience** : 
***Parking Lot Design***
interviewer was not at all open for extensibility of the design, he just focussed on
getting the requirements done (too strictly, ideally interviewer should be open
for that)
anyways managed to satisfy his expectations:
class structures attributes and methods
API specs with request/response models
DB schema with follow up questions based on foreign keys, sharding keys, indexing
then he wanted me to tell the flow of APIs verbally

Got selected in this round, HR moved to HM round

**Round 3** : Hiring Manager round
**Experience** : 30 mins discussion with a senior manager asked about my current project and some discussion around it.
then closed the interview with some basic behvaioural questions

Then later had a HR round post that offer was discussed, HR was too strict about the joining date.

*Compensation deets here : * https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6034789/Wayfair-or-SDE-2-or-Bengaluru

title: Amazon | SDE 2 | Bangalore | Jan 2025 | Offer
summary:
Hi everyone,

I wanted to share my interview experience for SDE 2 (L5) at Amazon Fire TV Stick team.

YOE -> 2.5 years (Without internship), 3.1 years (with
content:
Hi everyone,

I wanted to share my interview experience for **SDE 2 (L5)** at **Amazon Fire TV Stick team**.

YOE -> 2.5 years (Without internship), 3.1 years (with Internship)

---

## Application and OA:
In **November 2024**, I applied for a few positions in the Fire TV Stick group. Within 4 hours, I received an Online Assessment (OA) link.  

### OA Details:
1. **DSA Questions**: Solved 1 fully, partially solved the second (10/15 test cases).  
2. **System Design**: Answered scenario-based design questions.  
3. **Work Style Assessment**: Focused on Amazon’s **Leadership Principles (LPs)**.

---

## Interview Rounds:
I had **4 rounds** of interviews after the OA:

### R1: DSA + Leadership Principles (60 mins)
- 2 DSA Questions:  
  1. Similar to **intersection of Y-shaped linked lists**.  
  2. A variation of **Word Break**.  
- Discussed my current projects and **Leadership Principles**.

---

### R2: DSA + Leadership Principles (60 mins)
- Leadership discussion for 35 minutes.  
- 2 DSA Questions:  
  1. Similar to **Number of Islands II** (missed one edge case).  
  2. **Next Greater Element in a Circular Array** (shared approach but couldn’t code due to time).

---

### R3: Low-Level Design (Hiring Manager, 60 mins)
- Leadership discussion cum brief discussion on my project for 40 minutes.
- Design a memory allocator
	- Designed a **memory allocator** using linked lists. Implemented requested functionalities.  
- HM was very patient and supportive.

---

### R4: DSA (Bar Riser, 60 mins)
- **DSA Question**: Implement `x^n`  
  - Started with the brute force approach and optimized it using the **modular exponentiation** technique.  
  - Did a dry run of all the test cases.  
  - The interviewer asked me to optimize the code further to handle edge cases like `1^10000` and `-1^11111`.  
  - Fixed them after feedback but made minor mistakes in handling some cases.  

- Leadership discussion covered 3 principles.

---

## Outcome:
I received an offer for **System Development Engineer 2 (L5)** in the same team as my BR round did not go well, and my reporting manager would be the same as my **Hiring Manager (HM)**. I will eventually be converted to **Software Development Engineer 2 (L5)** based on my performance. 

I accepted the offer, considering the learning curve at Amazon and new learning opportunties. The work in my current company is highly saturated, with no scope for improvement, and the pay is average.

Compensation: https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6351729/Amazon-or-SDE-2-or-Bangalore-or-Offer

---

title: PayPal | SDE-3 | Bangalore
summary:
CSE B.Tech from Tier-1 Institution
3.5 years of experience in a product-based company.

Application Process and screening:
I might have applied through PayP
content:
CSE B.Tech from Tier-1 Institution
3.5 years of experience in a product-based company.

**Application Process and screening:**
I might have applied through PayPal portal(Not remember exactly). I received recruiter call and had discussion. She sent an OA, which i completed successfully. I think there were 3 questions and all were in range of Easy to Medium.

**Round 1:
Type: DSA Round**
First we had brief introduction from both sides, and then we moved on to the questions. The interviewer asked 2-3 SQL questions. Few questions around basic problem solving skills and SOLID. I didn't remember much from this round. I was expecting DSA but There wasn't any specific DSA problem.  
**Verdict: Lean hire**

**Round 2:
Type: Design(HLD) Round**
After introduction from both side moved to design question. First he asked few question sround design pattern and its usage. I didn't remember exact question. it was around something in which we should use Async processing and notifying to client. Overall it went well from my side.
**Verdict: Strong hire**

**Round 3:
Type: BR Round (Design-HLD + DSA)**
First he started with DSA question related to graph. it was boiled down to find diameter of given graph. I wasn't able to pick up i wrote brute force code from finding distance from one node to every other node. It passed given 3 tests but hidden ones were failing. He asked me to spent more time if i want. I spent some time but didn't get through. I asked him to move ahead. He asked design question which is having front end UI. When user adds cart it doesn't show up in UI immediately. I quickly understood that we need to use Async processing as soon as user adds item to cart. To make it faster i told about use of cache and using master slave architecture to make reads faster from DB. He seemed convinced with the provided solution.
**Verdict: Lean hire**

**Round 4:
Type: Managerial Round**
We had detailed introduction and he asked questions around handling different situations which occurs in day to day life of developer. I have share instances around which explains the situation. I have used STAR pattern to answer his questions. We started discussing about morals. he told about his family and where he came from. When he asked for mine my eyes were teary. Overall it was great discussion with him. He was really a great person.
**Verdict: Strong hire**

I wasn't expecting moving forward after round 3 as not able to pass all tests in graph question but it happened and finally got the offer. 
Compensation details: https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6260549/PayPal-Vs-Omnissa-or-Urgent-help-needed-or-offer-evaluation

I might have applied through PayPal portal(Not remember exactly). I received recruiter call and had discussion. She sent an OA, which i completed successfully. I think there were 3 questions and all were in range of Easy to Medium.

**Round 1:
Type: DSA Round**
First we had brief introduction from both sides, and then we moved on to the questions. The interviewer asked 2-3 SQL questions. Few questions around basic problem solving skills and SOLID. I didn't remember much from this round. I was expecting DSA but There wasn't any specific DSA problem.  
**Verdict: Lean hire**

**Round 2:
Type: Design(HLD) Round**
After introduction from both side moved to design question. First he asked few question sround design pattern and its usage. I didn't remember exact question. it was around something in which we should use Async processing and notifying to client. Overall it went well from my side.
**Verdict: Strong hire**

**Round 3:
Type: BR Round (Design-HLD + DSA)**
First he started with DSA question related to graph. it was boiled down to find diameter of given graph. I wasn't able to pick up i wrote brute force code from finding distance from one node to every other node. It passed given 3 tests but hidden ones were failing. He asked me to spent more time if i want. I spent some time but didn't get through. I asked him to move ahead. He asked design question which is having front end UI. When user adds cart it doesn't show up in UI immediately. I quickly understood that we need to use Async processing as soon as user adds item to cart. To make it faster i told about use of cache and using master slave architecture to make reads faster from DB. He seemed convinced with the provided solution.
**Verdict: Lean hire**

**Round 4:
Type: Managerial Round**
We had detailed introduction and he asked questions around handling different situations which occurs in day to day life of developer. I have share instances around which explains the situation. I have used STAR pattern to answer his questions. We started discussing about morals. he told about his family and where he came from. When he asked for mine my eyes were teary. Overall it was great discussion with him. He was really a great person.
**Verdict: Strong hire**

I wasn't expecting moving forward after round 3 as not able to pass all tests in graph question but it happened and finally got the offer. 
Compensation details: https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6260549/PayPal-Vs-Omnissa-or-Urgent-help-needed-or-offer-evaluation

title: Flipkart | SDE-2 | Interview Experience | Offer
summary:
BTech : Tier-3 college
YOE : 4 years
Previous experience : Software engineer at product-based org

How did I apply ?
A recruiter posted about a hiring driv
content:
**BTech :** Tier-3 college
**YOE :** 4 years
**Previous experience :** Software engineer at product-based org

**How did I apply ?**
A recruiter posted about a hiring drive for SDE-2 on LinkedIn and I applied there. After a week I got a mail that I am shortlisted for the interviews.

**Round 1 : Machine Coding(90 mins)**

I was given a document which had the machine coding question for which I had to do the implmentation on my local machine. The question was to implement a phonebook. A set of requirements was given and they had to be mandatorily implemented. Another set of bonus requirements was also given. If time is left then you can attempt these also.
While coding, basic OOPs principles have to be implemented as well as suitable design patterns. The code should be modular and extensible.

**Round 2 : Machine Coding Evaluation(30 mins)**
This round happened on the same day as the first round. In this round we had to explain the code that we had submitted in the first round.

**Round 3 : PS-DS Round(1 hr)**
This round happened after a week from the second round. Since my LWD was only a few days away the next three rounds were scheduled within a span of 2 days.
Two questions were given : 
1. Given an integer array, print the count of subarrays which had atmost k distinct elements. 
2. Given a number, find the minimum no of operations done to reduce the number to zero. An operation is defined as subtracting one of the digits from the number.

Since I solved both the questions pretty fast, I was given an extension to the second problem in which I had to print all the operations done.

**Round 4 : System Design(1 hr)**
This round was mainly focussed on high-level design. I was asked to provie the design for an UrbanClap like system. Database schema design, API design and high-level design was expected from this exercise.

**Round 5 : HM Round(1 hr)**
This round was mostly technical with the last 15 mins focussing on basic behavioural questions. Deep-dive in past projects as well as discussion on design choices.

**Verdict : Selected**
I got the offer letter after a week and have accepted the offer.

**Compensation details :**
https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/6160367/Flipkart-or-SDE-2

Now I have received the mail from another recruiter (post interviews, all interviews went sexy) to submit documents regarding my current salary and other offers I have.

I am also in negotiation phase of other company (startup) where I might get ( 36 base, 4 bonus, 1.05 relocation, 1.25 other benefits like insurance and all and ESOP worth 2 Lakh in first year).
In this startup I will also be getting bonus in next two year also and more ESOP's in upcoming year.
Should I tell this to MSFT, I am thinking if I tell this startup offer letter they will just give a little bit hike over this and will be less than Amazon SDE-2 salary or should wait for there initial offer letter or should negotiate just with my expected salary (Amazon SDE-2 salary)

P.S- I don't want to stay with Amazon as I don't like working with my manager and moreover I don't want to go again in the same process of finding time for interviewes during working days.
